// repeat 9x sko // repeat 9x sko row 12 k10 // k9 // k9 switching to i-cord to make the snout knit the remaining 8 stitches on one dpn row 13 buttonholes k10 // k5 yo k2tog k2 // k3 yo k2tog k4 and without turning the work row 14 k10 // k9 // k9 just sliding the work to the right of the left needle knit 7 row of i-cord row 15 k10 // k5 k2tog k2 // k2 sko k5 cut the yarn at 5-7cm 2-3 and pass it through the 8 stitches row 16 k10 // k4 k2tog k2 // k2 sko k4 smile eye string the smile is on the same row as the smile is made of 14 the mechanism between the following the arrows white lines the buttonhole in yellow on the embroidered stitches following eyes is a 5st i-cord of 90 -100 are inside the head yellow picture there are 3 stitches left the v shape of the knitted row pass it in through the outside between the buttonhole and the stitches buttonholes before the head is make a knot on each end of the start / end of the smile stuffed i-cord string and lock them firmly passing the tail yarn in and out several times hide the yarn tail into the i-cord froggybug 2-in-1 seahorse v3 page 14 of 16 front internal membrane this membrane is to contain the stuffing into the head get access to the base of the head pick up the 32 stitches around the neck stuff the head to the snout through the row 8 repeat 6 x k2 decrease k1 12 st from inside through the slot for the row 1 repeat k2 yo until the end of the row work row 9 repeat 6 x k2 decrease 6 st egg turning a part of the work there are 48 st cut the yarn at 5-10cm 2 -4 and pass it inside out row 2 repeat k2 kb until the end of the row through the remaining stitches pull it to get an even shape transfer the stitches so gently to close the membrane that there are 16 on each dpn row 3 repeat 6 x k2 decrease k6 42 st row 4 repeat 6 x k2 decrease k5 36 st row 5 repeat 6 x k2 decrease k4 30 st
